title: Houston survives on 'beautiful' last-second play
content: A perfectly executed inbounds play gave No. 1 Houston a 62-60 win over Purdue and a spot in the Elite Eight.

title: 'Generational' talent Betts keeps No. 1 UCLA rolling
content: Lauren Betts had 31 points and 10 rebounds as UCLA rolled past Ole Miss 76-62 to advance to the Elite Eight for the first time since 2018.

title: Betts revels in walk-off HR after emotional week
content: The emotions spilled out of Mookie Betts following Friday's walk-off homer, which capped an emotional start to the season in which an illness caused him to shed almost 20 pounds.

title: Dominant Morrow puts LSU in 3rd straight Elite 8
content: With Flau'Jae Johnson struggling, Aneesah Morrow carried the load with 30 points and 19 rebounds as LSU topped NC State 80-73 for its third straight Elite Eight appearance.

title: Gottlieb defends MSU: JuJu not hurt on dirty play
content: USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb condemned the online bullying against Mississippi State's Chandler Prater, saying she did not believe JuJu Watkins' ACL tear was the result of a dirty play.

title: Giannis on LeBron's praise: Unfair to compare eras
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo appreciated LeBron James' take that the Bucks star could have scored 250 points in a game if he'd played in the 1970s, but said "you can't compare this era with that era."

title: Liu ends U.S. drought, wins figure skating worlds
content: Alysa Liu dethroned three-time defending champion Kaori Sakamoto to become the first American women's figure skating world champion since 2006.

title: UCLA lands MWC Player of Year Dent from portal
content: Guard Donovan Dent, who averaged 20.4 points and 6.5 assists for New Mexico this season, has committed to UCLA after entering the transfer portal.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Six theories on why penalties (and power plays) are dramatically down this NHL season
content: Are players playing cleaner? Are referees swallowing their whistles? Players, execs, and analysts offer ideas.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Inside Elic Ayomanor's viral night and journey from Canada to the NFL draft
content: From Medicine Hat, Alberta, the Stanford receiver came along way to a record night against Travis Hunter and his NFL future.

title: Olympic champ Chloe Kim has a new outlook, new tricks -- and the old dominance
content: After struggling with depression, the snowboarder has found her joy again as she looks to qualify for the 2026 Olympics Saturday at Worlds.

title: Robinson's rise has Fulham dreaming of Europe and the U.S. a World Cup
content: In a breakout season, Fulham's Antonee Robinson has emerged as one of the best left backs in the world, and he's dreaming of big things with the U.S.

title: Helen Hu's unexpected path back to NCAA gymnastics
content: A year ago, Helen Hu was retired from gymnastics and working at a hostel in Ecuador. This past weekend, she won the SEC beam title.

title: Brazil fires coach Dorival after loss to Argentina
content: Brazil has dismissed head coach Dorival Júnior following Tuesday's deflating loss to rivals Argentina, Brazil's Football Confederation (CBF) announced Friday.

title: Ex-Timber awarded $20M in malpractice lawsuit
content: Former New Zealand international Jake Gleeson has won a medical malpractice lawsuit against Portland Timbers team doctor Richard H. Edelson, with a jury awarding him over $20 million.

title: Osasuna appeal, say Barça player was ineligible
content: Osasuna filed an appeal with the Spanish football federation (RFEF) on Friday stating Barcelona should not have fielded defender Iñigo Martínez in their LaLiga game over a technicality as he sat out Spain's matches with an injury.

title: USWNT's Davidson (knee) exits Gotham FC draw
content: NJ/NY Gotham FC and U.S. women's national team defender Tierna Davidson will be evaluated upon returning to New Jersey after suffering a left knee injury in Friday's 0-0 draw against the Houston Dash.

title: James blasts FIFA 'injustice' over León CWC axing
content: León captain James Rodríguez and coach Eduardo Berizzo urged FIFA on Friday to reconsider booting the Mexican team from the Club World Cup

title: Bayern threaten to sue Canada over Davies injury
content: Bayern Munich said they are considering legal action against the Canadian soccer federation following Alphonso Davies' serious knee injury.

title: Herdman reprimanded in Canada drone scandal
content: Following a disciplinary hearing, former Canada soccer coach John Herdman was formally admonished in writing for his involvement in a drone-spying scandal at the Paris Olympics.

title: Dani Alves sexual assault conviction overturned
content: The top court in Spain's Catalonia region said Friday it had overturned the conviction of Brazilian soccer player Dani Alves for sexual assault.

title: Barca, Madrid ... or Atletico -- who wins LaLiga?

title: Breaking down the Premier League run-in, UCL race
content: A season that has defied expectations looks set for a thrilling contest for Champions League qualification.

title: AIIMS (Delhi) performs rare keyhole surgery for pancreatic cancer in a child
content: The 11-year old became the youngest patient worldwide to undergo this complex procedure entirely by laparoscopic route.

title: Fatal head injuries are declining with helmet use, but there is still a long way to go, say doctors
content: For every death in a road traffic accident, there are around 50 who meet with non-fatal accidents and suffer head injuries that may take years to heal, say doctors, calling for stricter enforcement of helmet regulations among all riders and pillion riders

title: India sends 80 NDRF personnel to quake-hit Myanmar
content: Commandant P.K. Tiwary of the 8th NDRF battalion based in Ghaziabad will lead the Urban Search And Rescue team.

title: In Kerala, stricter driving tests prove a bumpy ride as pass rates drop to 52%
content: As part of tightening driving test process, MVD had put a cap on the number of tests to be conducted under a motor vehicle inspector to 40 per day

title: Two Maoists from Chhattisgarh involved in recruitment arrested in ASR district in Andhra Pradesh
content: The duo had been actively involved in the recruitment of new members for the outlawed CPI (Maoist), said ASR Superintendent of Police

title: MP govt changes ‘unemployed’ to ‘aspirational youth’; opposition fumes

title: Dallewal has not ended indefinite fast, says farmer leader
content: Countering the Punjab government's claims, farmer leader Abhimanyu Kohar said Jagjit Dallewal had made it clear he would take water only after all the farmers are released.

title: Plans afoot to promote natural farming and local crop varieties in Nandyal district of A.P.
content: Horticulture crops were being grown in 48,000 hectares and the administration is trying to increase the extent of the crops by another 10,000 hectares, District Collector said

title: Kathua encounter: J&K deputy CM says conspiracies hatched from across border ‘killing our children’
content: Mr. Abdullah, Mr. Choudhary and DGP were also seen expressing their condolences to the bereaved family.

title: BJP's 'cronyism' caused banking sector crisis, junior employees suffering: Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress leader shared a video of his meeting with a delegation of ex-ICICI bank employees, who he said have suffered due to the "mismanagement"

title: Kodagu quadruple murder: Police nab accused in Kerala
content: Girish (38) had hacked to death his wife Nagi (32), their stepdaughter Cauvery (7), and Nagi’s grandparents, Kariya and Gauri, both above 70 years of age.

title: Wealth of Telangana is TDP’s contribution, says Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: The TDP had ushered in the welfare era under the stewardship of NTR in a manner which no other State could do, Chanddrababu Naidu said at the TDP Formation Day celebrations

title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra alleges Centre is blocking discussions in Parliament
content: Priyanka Gandhi says Union government's approach is to avoid discussions by any means possible, using various tactics to do so

title: Krishna water dispute cited for denial of national status to Palamuru project
content: The MP urged the Central Government to interfere in the water share dispute and resolve the issue rather than citing the dispute to give national status to the project.

content: Government Railway Police arrests five in IPL betting scam, involving Aadhaar and PAN card fraud, with illegal transactions up to ₹1 lakh

title: Maharashtra Government sets up protocol to counter ‘incorrect’ media reports on schemes
content: GAD directs departments to counter misinformation about Maharashtra Government promptly with a new protocol in place

title: ISRO achieves breakthrough in Semicryogenic engine development for LVM3
content: ISRO achieves breakthrough in semicryogenic engine development with successful hot test of Engine Power Head Test Article

title: Kathua encounter: Search operation for militants extended to new areas in J&K

title: River Ganga pollution: Supreme Court stays NGT order imposing ₹50,000 cost on Bihar
content: Supreme Court issued notice to the Centre and others seeking their responses on the plea within four weeks

content: Madhya Pradesh’s Sambal Yojana provides financial assistance and benefits to unorganised sector workers, empowering laborers across the state

title: Dr. Nageshwar Reddy on innovation, health, and the road ahead

title: Statehood in Jammu and Kashmir to be restored as promised: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah promises restoration of Statehood in Jammu and Kashmir without disclosing a timeline

title: Air Force civil engineer shot dead at his home in Prayagraj
content: Indian Air Force civil engineer shot dead in his sleep, investigation ongoing, legal action to be taken

title: Panel discussion watch live: understanding youth violence – causes & solutions
content: Kerala has recently witnessed concerning incidents of violence among youth, sparking urgent conversations about their root causes and solutions. Join us for a thoughtful discussion featuring experts from psychiatry, education, cinema, and youth perspectives.

title: 85% of Telangana people to get 6kg fine rice each from Ugadi: Uttam
content: Telangana currently has around 90 lakh ration cards. Nearly 30 lakh new ration cards expected to be issued: Minister

title: BBMP Budget 2025-26 crosses ₹19,000 crore, focus on infrastructure development
content: A major share of 65% of the budget, amounting to ₹12,952.20 crore, has been allocated for development works, highlighting the administration’s focus on urban expansion and improvements.

title: NCLAT reduces penalty on Google to ₹216 crore in Play Store matter
content: Appellate tribunal NCLAT on Friday upheld the order passed by fair trade regulator CCI against Google for abusing its dominant position with respect to Play Store policies

title: Saif Ali Khan stabbing case: Accused files bail plea, claims case is 'false'
content: The bail application states that the FIR was registered improperly and the accused has fully cooperated with the investigation and that all evidence is already with the police, making any tampering impossible

title: Disha Salian was depressed due to father’s misuse of money, claims police closure report
content: Actor Sushant Singh Rajput’s former manager Disha Salian’s death case raises questions of suicide, depression, and alleged misuse of funds by family

title: Chhattisgarh encounter: 16 Maoists killed, two jawans injured in Sukma; Amit Shah says weapons can’t bring change

title: Self-styled pastor Bajinder Singh convicted for rape in 2018 case

title: Bihar Government will confiscate property of Lalu Prasad to recover money swindled from fodder scam: Samrat Choudhary

title: A heinous crime and a wake up call for Hyderabad’s suburban train services
content: Rape attempt on a woman passenger travelling to Medchal on local train last Saturday (March 22, 2025) lays bare gaping holes in security. Damage control measures by South Central Railway fail to impress commuters, who say it has turned a blind eye to obvious red flags

title: Maharashtra CM releases grant of over ₹25 crore to 560 cowsheds under Desi Govansh Pariposhan Yojana
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister has deposited ₹ 25 crore 44 lakh to 560 cowsheds under Desi Govansh Pariposhan Yojana for the months of January, February and March.

title: Myanmar earthquake: India’s National Centre for Seismology says soil liquefaction caused severe damage
content: Another major reason for the damage was that the earthquake's shaking frequency matched the natural vibration of buildings, making those more vulnerable, the NCS said

title: Coffee Board launches GI-tagged, single-serve drip bags
content: We are planning to sell coffee online to popularise and promote GI-tagged coffee and make them accessible to consumers across the country, says Coffee Board Secretary and CEO K.G. Jagadeesha

title: Protests across Jammu region against killings of cops in Kathua
content: The Congress, the BJP, the Shiv Sena Dogra Front and the Rashtriya Bajrang Dal held protests against Pakistan in various parts of the Jammu belt

title: Chinese electric car maker BYD likely to drive into Telangana with first plant in India
content: It is set to be a mega project given the expected investment and also spur growth of an ecosystem of component makers and create thousands of jobs

title: Ranya Rao case: A minefield of gold blows up
content: The alleged gold smuggling case involving Ranya Rao, an actor and the step-daughter of an IPS officer in Karnataka, has sent shock waves through Karnataka. While the Opposition has questioned the ruling Congress over the involvement of politicians, serious concerns have been raised about the security breach at the airport and the abuse of police protocol by the families of officers, reports K.V. Aditya Bharadwaj

title: Over 1,800 contempt cases in Supreme Court, 1.43 lakh across High Courts remain pending: Law Minister
content: The reasons for non-compliance with the orders in contempt cases pending before the Supreme Court and various High Courts are not available with the government, said Arjun Ram Meghwal

title: Delhi HC rejects Centre’s order cancelling OCI card of academic Ashok Swain
content: Academician Swain in his plea filed in 2023 had argued that his mother who lived in India was unwell and he was the only son and hadn’t been able to visit India in the past three years

title: Army inducts in-house developed First Person View drones
content: Indian Army introduces FPV drone with anti-tank payload, developed internally in collaboration with TBRL, marking a tactical warfare milestone

content: In line with NEP 2020, CBSE has launched a parenting calendar to better structure parents involvement in students lives

title: Srinagar’s Jama Masjid shut, police book organisers of procession
content: A case was registered against the organisers and participants of a Youm-e-Quds procession in Sonpah village, Beerwah, for creating a law and order situation

title: WoW Awards: The Hindu honours women in diverse fields
content: Women’s appearance in public spaces has become more significant and inevitable today, says Justice R.N. Manjula at the The Hindu World of Women (WoW) Awards 2025

title: Delhi govt. to bring in cow protection law
content: Home Minister makes announcement in Assembly after BJP MLA Ashok Goel cites data on accidents due to stray cows; Mustafabad MLA proposes changing constituency’s name to Shiv Nagar; ruckus after AAP legislators, LoP marshalled out

title: Reconsider building working women’s hostel in varsity grounds, says SPCSS-TN
content: Govt. has planned to build a working women’s hostel in varsity’s Ramanujan Institute for Advanced Study in Mathematics

title: Atishi asks BJP to explain source of ₹1-lakh-crore budget
content: “Delhi’s actual revenue will be ₹78,000 crore, not ₹1-lakh-crore, and Chief Minster Rekha Gupta has misled the people of Delhi,” Ms. Atishi said

title: Remove Aurangzeb’s tomb from the list of protected monuments: Shiv Sena
content: The tomb, situated in Khultabad near Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar in Maharashtra, is under the protection of Archaeological Survey of India as a ‘monument of national importance’

title: BPSC Row: Patna High Court dismisses petitions demanding fresh examination
content: Acting Chief Justice of the Patna HC, Ashutosh Kumar, delivered the order directing the Commission shall carry out the Mains Examination, ensuring that the process is peaceful, fair, and transparent

title: Five teams deployed to probe pastor’s death; wife’s statement recorded
content: East Godavari SP deploys five teams to investigate pastor Praveen Kumar’s suspicious death; wife’s statement recorded in Hyderabad

title: Defence Ministry signs ₹62,700-crore contract with HAL to buy 156 light combat helicopters
content: This is India’s first indigenously designed and developed high altitude combat helicopter; plan to achieve indigenous manufacture of 65% of components as well; IAF to lease flight refuelling aircraft

title: Set up committee to help women and children in strife-torn Manipur, panel urges Ministry
content: Take steps to safeguard them from sexual violence in relief camps, educate the displaced children, and provide jobs for the affected women, says parliamentary panel

title: WRD plans to build six check dams across Palar river at cost of ₹30 crore each
content: new check dams in will help in storing excess rainwater during monsoon. Large tracts of farmlands along the river can benefit from uninterrupted irrigation, says a farmer

title: India sends 15 tonnes of relief material to earthquake-hit Myanmar
content: Over 150 people killed as powerful 7.7 magnitude earthquake rocks Myanmar, Thailand; destroys buildings, bridge, and dam

title: Air India Express projects 50% passenger growth in FY 2026

title: Rahul Gandhi meets bank employees worried about retrenchment and privatisation
content: ICICI employee delegation claims they were dismissed while on medical leave or after raising concerns about management; IDBI workers worried about privatisation despite earlier assurances

content: External Affairs Minister responds to questions in Parliament on minority rights in Bangladesh and Pakistan; he says India has raised issue at international forums or with the government concerned; Islamabad brazenly harbours terrorists, he adds

title: CBI says R.G. Kar case not gang rape, to continue probe on ‘conspiracy, cover-up, evidence destruction’

title: A.P. govt. allocates ₹600 crore for development of roads

title: Over 1,000 Dead, 2,376 Injured: Myanmar-Thailand Quakes Flatten Buildings
content: A massive earthquake struck Myanmar and parts of neighbouring Thailand, leaving a trail of destruction and a mounting death count. As of Saturday, the death count in Myanmar and Thailand is over 1,000.

content: Myanmar, Thailand Earthquake Live Updates: The death count from a massive earthquake in Myanmar has jumped to 1,002, with 2,376 people injured, the country's ruling junta said Saturday.

title: Video: Doctors Deliver Baby On Bangkok Street Minutes After Massive Quake
content: Doctors in Bangkok delivered a baby on the street outside the Police General Hospital during the massive earthquake in Thailand. The woman was in surgery when the tremors hit on Friday, and doctors were forced to evacuate the hospital.

title: "You Know PM Modi Was...": Donald Trump Replies To India Tariff Question
content: Trump had earlier said that India was a very high-tariff nation and reciprocal tariffs on countries that impose levies on American goods would kick in on April 2.

title: Air Force Civil Engineer Shot Dead At His Home In Prayagraj
content: An unknown person shot at the engineer from the window while he was sleeping in his room in Engineers Colony inside the Air Force Station, Puramufti Station House Officer (SHO) Manoj Singh said.

title: Why US Is Asking Hundreds Of International Students To Self-Deport
content: Hundreds of international students studying in the US have received emails from the US Department of State (DOS), telling them to self-deport as their F-1 visas (student visas) have been revoked owing to campus activism.

title: Trying To Find Love, Noida Man Loses Rs 6.3 Crore Life Savings

title: More Trouble For Stand-Up Comedian Kunal Kamra Over Eknath Shinde Parody

title: Open Jeep, Gun, 'Mehbooba Mehbooba': Reel Stunt Lands Man In Trouble

title: How killer techie fooled tenant, misled cops after killing wife
content: Rakesh Rajendra Khedekar admitted to killing his wife, Gouri Anil Sambrekar, after a dispute over her job search and unemployment issues. Following the murder, he falsely informed a tenant that Gouri had committed suicide. Rakesh planned to surrender but was apprehended by police beforehand.

title: Centre vs X: Govt slams Musk's platform for calling 'Sahyog' censorship tool
content: The Centre has criticised social media platform X for calling the 'Sahyog' portal a censorship tool, describing the claim as unfortunate and condemnable. It emphasized Section 69A's authority for blocking orders under specific conditions and defended the portal's role in addressing unlawful content.

title: Donald Trump imposes 25% import tariff on car imports; Musk responds
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on auto imports and parts, which takes effect on April 3. This decision targets foreign-made cars, light trucks, and key auto parts. Elon Musk highlighted that these tariffs would increase the cost of parts in Tesla cars sourced from other countries.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli shoves CSK's Khaleel in front of Dhoni
content: The IPL match between RCB and CSK was marked by a heated confrontation between Virat Kohli and Khaleel Ahmed. RCB secured a 50-run victory, breaking their Chepauk jinx. Kohli's frustration with Khaleel overshadowed the win, sparking fan discussions. RCB's batting and bowling performances were highlighted by contributions from Rajat Patidar, Tim David, Josh Hazlewood, and Yash Dayal.

title: 'Resolving conflict must be national priority': Rahul meets Manipur leaders
content: Rahul Gandhi met Manipur leaders amid ongoing violence and criticized PM Modi for not visiting the state. He urged for a national priority in resolving the crisis. Manipur has been under President's rule since February after the chief minister resigned due to ethnic violence between Meitei and Kuki-Zo tribes, resulting in over 250 deaths.

title: 15-hour-plus Raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Fake ISI mark products seized
content: The Bureau of Indian Standards has conducted extensive raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi targeting counterfeit and substandard products. Thousands of items, including geysers, food mixers, electrical appliances, and sports footwear lacking proper ISI certification, were seized with an estimated value of Rs 70 lakh.

title: '10 times better': AB de Villiers praises RCB's squad balance
content: RCB's improved squad balance has been hailed by AB de Villiers after their impressive start in IPL 2025. With significant contributions from players like Bhuvneshwar Kumar, RCB have secured consecutive away victories against CSK and KKR. The team's depth and chemistry are major factors in their strong performance and promising start to the season.

title: 'Not a terrorist': Sanjay Raut demands special protection for Kamra
content: Sanjay Raut demands special protection for comedian Kunal Kamra, who faces multiple legal cases over remarks about Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde. He compares Kamra's situation to that of Kangana Ranaut, who received security after a dispute with Shiv Sena, and calls for government intervention.

title: Rohit: 'Imagine if we'd won the final against Australia as well'
content: Rohit Sharma reflects on India's resilience and shift in mindset that led to impressive runs in ICC tournaments over the past nine months. Despite some setbacks, including a rare home Test series loss and a tough IPL season, India won the ICC Champions Trophy and T20 World Cup under his leadership.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's GPT-4o update, which creates Studio Ghibli-style portraits, is currently restricted to paid subscription tiers due to high demand. However, users can still generate Ghibli-inspired art for free using alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI models, and other third-party tools, or by leveraging free trials on premium AI platforms.

title: Man kills 5-month-old twin daughters in Raj over desire for son; arrested
content: In a tragic incident in Sikar district's Neem Ka Thana town, Ashok Kumar allegedly killed his nearly 5-month-old twin daughters due to his desire for a son. The crime was reported by the twins' mother, Anita, who revealed a history of harassment. Kumar buried the bodies, and police arrested him after being alerted by Anita's brother.

title: 'Whether we lose or win, we have to smile': Rohit shares MI mindset
content: Former MI skipper Rohit Sharma emphasises the importance of maintaining a positive attitude regardless of outcomes in a video shared by Mumbai Indians. He highlights resilience as key to MI's success. Despite an early defeat in IPL 2025, Rohit encourages the team to stay positive and keep fighting in the upcoming match against Gujarat Titans.

title: Moon sighting for Eid-ul-Fitr 2025: When to watch in India, UAE, and Saudi Arabia
content: The moon sighting is crucial because it marks the beginning of Shawwal, the month following Ramadan, and indicates the end of fasting. As we approach the end of Ramadan 2025, Muslims around the world are waiting for the official announcement that signals the start of Eid-ul-Fitr. Whether you're in India, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, or elsewhere, the exact timing can vary, but the excitement and spirit of celebration remain the same.

content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Girls called 'samaan': Self-proclaimed gurus target young girls from poor UP families
content: Sambhal police arrested 14 men involved in a gang that exploited young women under the guise of tantric rituals for wealth. The victims, from various districts in Uttar Pradesh, were subjected to sexual exploitation. Authorities discovered videos and images of the victims. Investigations revealed the gang targeted financially vulnerable families, promising them monetary gains.

title: 'India stands in solidarity': PM Modi speaks to Myanmar junta chief
content: Prime Minister Modi expressed condolences to Myanmar after a 7.7 magnitude earthquake caused widespread damage. India has launched 'Operation Brahma' to provide immediate relief, including tents, food, and medical supplies. Myanmar's military junta reports over 1,000 deaths and thousands injured, with rescue operations ongoing.

title: Rakesh Roshan: It’s the right time for Hrithik to take Krrish forward
content: Krrish is ingrained in Hrithik, so he's the best person to direct Krrish 4 and take the mantle ahead, reveals Rakesh Roshan.

title: Army intensifies hunt for terrorists in J&K’s Kathua, war-like stores found
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district intensified their search for remaining terrorists after an encounter resulted in the deaths of four policemen and two Pakistani terrorists. The ongoing 'Operation Safiyan' is conducted by the J&K Police, Army, NSG, BSF, and CRPF. War-like stores were recovered, including IED materials and grenades.

title: 3 centenarians reveal secret to long life – and it's not diet or exercise!
content: Longevity is what has kept the humanity intrigued for centuries. Is there a formula to it? Is there a secret that we don't know? One of the women, who was 100 years old, when asked what is the secret to being 100, said, "Do everything wrong, don't have diet coke, have regular coke, don't exercise, and most importantly, don't worry". She further went on to add that she likes coffee, has ice cream 'all the time', and still drinks alcohol.

title: Love triangle ends in marriage: Man marries 2 women in one ceremony; watch
content: Suryadev, a man from Lingapur mandal, married two women, Kanaka Lal and Atram Jalkar Devi, in a single ceremony following tribal customs. Village elders witnessed the event, which took place in Kumurambheem Asifabad district. Nearly 1,000 people from nearby villages attended the wedding. Suryadev signed a bond to pledge equal care for both brides.

title: 'Misrepresented': Indian-American student on Hinduism course by Houston University
content: An Indian-American student at Houston University has accused a Hinduism course of bias, alleging it misrepresented aspects of the Hindu religion and politically branded PM Narendra Modi as a Hindu fundamentalist. The university defended its course as academically rigorous and committed to exploring complex religious and political issues.

title: 'Minister's statement factual': Tharoor backs EAM's remarks on Pakistan's
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor expressed concern over the worsening treatment of minorities in Pakistan, highlighting disturbing incidents involving the Sikh, Ahmadiyya, and Christian communities. He emphasized the lack of dialogue between India and Pakistan, making it difficult to address these issues directly.

title: Indian Air Force civil engineer shot dead at home in UP
content: A civil engineer of the Indian Air Force was shot dead while sleeping at his official residence in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh. An unidentified assailant fired through the window, leading to the victim's death after being taken to the Army hospital. The incident is under investigation.

title: 'Slapped, gagged, stabbed': How Bengaluru techie stuffed wife into suitcase 'alive'
content: A 36-year-old man in Bengaluru, Rakesh Rajendra Khedekar, is suspected of premeditated murder after stabbing his wife, Gouri Anil Sambrekar, and attempting to hide her body in a suitcase during a domestic argument. Police believe he transported her to Bengaluru with the intent to kill her, following a series of deception efforts to mislead authorities.

title: Gaiety Galaxy's Manoj Desai on hiking 'Sikandar' ticket prices: 'We had to...'
content: Manoj Desai, Executive director of G7multiplex (Gaiety Galaxy) & Maratha Mandir Cinema says that he also had to increase the ticket price of 'Sikandar' to Rs 180-200 at his single screens.

title: Virginity tests unconstitutional, violate women's dignity: HC
content: The Chhattisgarh High Court has reaffirmed that virginity tests are unconstitutional, violating the right to dignity under Article 21. This decision came in response to a criminal revision petition challenging a Family Court order that rejected a husband's request for his wife's virginity test during a maintenance claim dispute.

title: UP officer transferred after refusing repeated tea requests from BJP MLA
content: A 58-year-old assistant development officer battling cancer was transferred and faces suspension for refusing to serve tea to Hapur BJP MLA Vijay Pal during a press briefing. The disciplinary actions were prompted by a formal complaint from the MLA following the officer's repeated refusals and agitated response.

title: CSK coach Fleming loses cool, lashes out at reporter
content: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming showed frustration in a press conference after their first loss of the season to RCB. Fleming called a journalist's question about CSK's playing style 'silly' and defended their approach, emphasizing the difficulties in adapting to the Chepauk pitch. The match marked CSK’s first defeat of the season, with RCB securing their first victory at Chepauk since 2008, winning by 50 runs.

title: Refused admission twice, woman delivers on handcart in MP, baby dies
content: A woman in MP's Ratlam district, turned away twice by a community health center despite being in labor, gave birth on a handcart, resulting in the baby's death. The administration has taken action against the medical staff involved, suspending two nurses and showcausing the block medical officer following an investigation.

title: Houston University clarifies on Hinduism course after misrepresentation claims
content: The University of Houston defended its Hindu religion course, explaining that the use of terms like 'fundamentalism' is grounded in academic religious studies. The course aims to analyze how religions evolve over time, without making judgments or showing bias, despite student complaints.

title: Chepauk DJ plays 'Dosa, Idli, Sambar' as Jitesh walks off
content: During the match at MA Chidambaram Stadium, the Chepauk DJ playfully trolled Jitesh Sharma after his dismissal by playing a popular song. RCB's victory over CSK was marked by tight bowling performances, securing their first win at Chepauk since 2008 and topping the points table. This victory also marked RCB’s first win at Chepauk since 2008, breaking a 17-year drought at CSK’s fortress.

title: Watch: Hit on helmet, Virat Kohli does this
content: In the IPL 2025 clash against Chennai Super Kings, Virat Kohli was hit on the helmet by a bouncer from Matheesha Pathirana but reassured his well-being with a thumbs-up. Following a mandatory concussion check, Kohli hit a six and a four off consecutive balls. RCB secured a 50-run victory, marking CSK's first home defeat to them in 17 years.

title: Joke row: Mumbai Police register 3 cases against Kunal Kamra
content: Comedian Kunal Kamra faces three cases in Mumbai, including complaints by Jalgaon's Mayor, a Nashik hotelier, and a businessman. Kamra, summoned twice by police, has been granted anticipatory bail by the Madras High Court citing safety concerns. Legal action stems from his remarks during a comedy show.

title: Watch: 0.16 seconds! MS Dhoni effects Phil Salt stumping in a flash
content: At age 43, Mahendra Singh Dhoni displayed his extraordinary wicketkeeping prowess during an IPL 2025 match against RCB, executing a lightning-fast stumping that ended Phil Salt's aggressive innings. Dhoni's remarkable reflexes and cricketing intelligence continue to amaze, reinforcing his legendary status in the sport. With every such moment, Dhoni reinforces his legacy as a generational wicketkeeping genius, proving once again that age is just a number.

title: Myanmar earthquake: Why quakes strike certain regions more often
content: A powerful 7.7-magnitude earthquake hit near Mandalay, Myanmar, causing extensive damage and reaching Bangkok. The quake, originating from the Sagaing Fault, has resulted in significant fatalities and destruction, with experts predicting aftershocks for months. Myanmar's seismic vulnerability is attributed to its complex fault lines within the Alpide Belt.

title: International students wake up to email asking them to self deport for campus activism
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities.
